fields.description:
I have patch as EUCA-4211, but this issue can also appear, as the comment of [~sjones]  

"Concurrent private network index allocation is now supported, we do not support concurrent allocation for the extant network. This means you may see failures in tests, but the cause will be insertion into 'metadata_extant_network' rather than 'metadata_network_indices'"

This issue have not fixed. Please help to check.

fields.summary: System Mode run instance frequently error

comments.body: Need furthering information to reproduce the problem. One possible use case, run two instances with in the same security group may cause this problem with conflicting security groups.
EUCA-7071 has additional info / steps to reproduce for this issue.

The fix for this issue includes an upgrade task to remove the redundant "vm_network_index" column from the "metadata_network_group" table in the "eucalyptus_cloud" database.

EUCA-7071 has details for reproducing the issue (on a setup using static network mode)

Fix Verified.

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 3.4.0
Release     : 0.0.1502.20130920git17d3b99d.el6

There is no longer vm_network_index column in metadata_network_group table. The error is not seen in the log after running example script from linked bug. Tested using system mode.

{code}
eucalyptus_cloud=# select id,creation_timestamp,last_update_timestamp,version,metadata_network_group_id, metadata_display_name, metadata_account_name, vm_network_index from metadata_network_group;
ERROR:  column "vm_network_index" does not exist
LINE 1: ...id, metadata_display_name, metadata_account_name, vm_network...
{code}
